website_summaries.verdict: A highly rated computer science book that’s a useful resource for academic study or as an introduction to anyone curious about computer science.
pros: Well liked for its emphasis on creativity in the field of computer science as well as its creative approach to explain formal principles
Helps reviewers understand some of the most complex computer science concepts, like coding
A great reference for computer science classes or exams
cons: Offers more of a basic overview of programming

customer_reviews.title: This book lit a fire in my heart
customer_reviews.text: This book helped me understand some of the most complex computer science concepts. My incompetent computer science teacher made me question why I even signed up for a computer science course but after reading this book I stopped failing computer science. My parents no longer hate me and I am thriving in AP computer science principles. I actually feel prepared for the exam now, as I didn’t before because my computer science teacher is literally insane and doesn’t teach us. this book is a lifesaver!!!
customer_reviews.author: defective-detector

customer_reviews.title: Needs more Computer Science Related Concepts
customer_reviews.text: This book wasn't what I though it was. Personally, I thought it contained more knowledge on Computer Science, but it lacked anything really useful for AP Computer Science Principles. This book really only covered what a computer was and binary. It lacked any fundamental understanding of any programming language. Honestly, not helpful for someone preparing for the AP Computer Science Principles Exam. Overall, the book lacks quality content. This book is more for someone is trying to understand how a computer works.
customer_reviews.author: Study Guide Specialist

customer_reviews.title: A great piece of literature filled with the best computer science knowledge anyone could ask for!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best computer science book I have ever read. Before getting this book I was clueless in my AP computer science class. After reading this book I had a much better understanding of my computer science class. This book is perfect for AP Computer Science Principles. It got me super prepared for all of the AP projects and the final exam. It is filled with information but simple to understand. I would recommend this book to any high schooler taking AP Computer Science Principles or just anyone who wants to learn about computer science.
customer_reviews.author: William Turton

customer_reviews.title: It's not the class AP CSP
customer_reviews.text: So, I got this book because there's a newer course called Computer Science Principles. This book isn't for that new AP exam, it's a general introduction to Computer Science. Seems pretty user friendly, but I was super disappointed when I realized it was not what I had wanted.
customer_reviews.author: College Stealth

customer_reviews.title: and easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: As an educator, I appreciate the way this resource is logical, straightforward, and easy to understand. My students taking AP Computer Science will find this resource a helpful supplement to the AP Computer Science course, and even those not enrolled in the course will find it useful as a guide for understanding. Moreover, this book celebrates the unlimited creativity that can be imagined and achieved in this field rather than emphasizing formulaic rigidity, which will inspire all students of the study, regardless of age!
customer_reviews.author: mam2222

customer_reviews.title: Computer Science Principles provides a wonderful entry point into what is a wildly popular and ...
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher and parent of a high school student interested in the subject I found the book very helpful. The creative approach the author has taken to distill the subject is refreshing. Computer Science Principles provides a wonderful entry point into what is a wildly popular and growing subject matter in high schools I'm certain across the country. Thank you for such a great and creative approach in the subject.
customer_reviews.author: Thinker of Thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Good read
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old really likes this book ! I am impressed. I am somewhat tech savy, and found the book quite interesting. Easy read, understand for most. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M.

customer_reviews.title: Good general information
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for general information, this book is an excellent resource.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Textbook
customer_reviews.text: Great book! Computer Science Principles makes for an excellent textbook for both AP and regular high school computer science classes. It takes complex concepts and explains them in an easily understood and creative way.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Code word: Approved
customer_reviews.text: Hare breaks down the idea of coding in a way that if not easily understood, makes it understandable for even the most complicated reader. I am not a 'techie' or into coding as a hobby, but I am interested enough to want to have a knowledge of how things work. I feel that this book will be a great reference in the future for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Great content in an easy to read format
customer_reviews.text: This book was very detailed and simultaneously easy to read. The author does a good job of simplifying an otherwise complicated topic. I would highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Essential book for teaching AP CS Principles or Introductory CS Course
customer_reviews.text: This book is absolutly essential as a companion to teaching AP CS Principles. As a teacher, I would be at a loss for exactly how to teach this course and provide an essential foundation for students without this book. It is a MUST buy for teachers and students taking this course or any introductory CS course!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Gray

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Computer Science Book
customer_reviews.text: This book helped me get into computer science, a usually daunting subject. It was very easy to understand and well written, making a hard subject seem easy. If someone is looking to get into the field of computer science, this is a must use. The only problem that I have with this book, is that it is not included as part of the bible. It is that good.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Not that useful for preparing for AP Computer Science exam
customer_reviews.text: The book is ok. I was looking for something for my son that would be an organized way to prepare for the AP Computer Science Principles exam. I.e., that would distill the huge amount of information on Code.org into a format that could be studied for purposes of the test. This book was only ok. Short. Breezy. Decent overview. Better than nothing, but not a well-organized, comprehensive study guide.
customer_reviews.author: J Ro

customer_reviews.title: Supremely written to enable your understanding of computer science principles.
customer_reviews.text: This book has been fantastic at outlining and illustrating the principles of computer science! The author did a tremendous job of making sure there was an appropriate amount of depth while utilizing a writing style that drives you to grasp and understand the material. Overall a fantastic resource!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This book is a must have if you are taking or teaching computer science! I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: corrected
customer_reviews.text: im correcting my original review due to the fact that i mixed up the books, these are great books in the order in which they was written. and i recommend purchasing both editions one and two , in order to get a more comprehensive understanding of the topics and all that is explained within.
customer_reviews.author: LaFaye

customer_reviews.title: Good book!
customer_reviews.text: This was a big help as I recently acquired dreamweaver, and was also unfamiliar with applying bootstrap when developing a webpage. Good book!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro E. Marquez

customer_reviews.title: great study aid
customer_reviews.text: As a student, this book is a great resource when preparing for the AP principals exam. Kevin Hare explains the complex code in a way that can be interpreted by any student. I highly recommend this book for any student preparing for the AP principles exam.
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: Good intro to multiple topics
customer_reviews.text: Covers a wide range of relevant topics in an easy to understand way!
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Swing and miss
customer_reviews.text: This book was ( in my opinion ) pretty bad. Way better books out there. Computer science for AP? And they have dreamweaver, excel, and photoshop. Bad book.
customer_reviews.author: A&A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Very well done! Excellent introductory book for both students or hobbyists. Would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: A helpful guide
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my brother as a gift and he’s really enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Useless book containing widely known information with no great detail
customer_reviews.author: tsbraga9

customer_reviews.title: LIFE ALTERING
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to fail my ap comp sci exam but this book proved a helpful last minute cram
customer_reviews.author: Blaise

customer_reviews.title: I give it a C++.
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed. Written so you can follow along in the applications.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: The book is made of fluff and isn't very useful. It's very chaotic, in fact. There are some parts of it which are useful, so I give it three stars. It lacks the clear idea about its readers and it's very chaotic and poorly edited.
customer_reviews.author: Pawel Owczarek

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS BOOK.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a high school student and decided to go through it. Read the first chapter and found it to be badly written and misinforming / misleading. For example, the ‘operating system’ is defined as ‘the visual representation of a computer’. This is utter nonsense. It is not worth going through the rest of the book.
customer_reviews.author: rml

customer_reviews.title: Straightforward and Educational
customer_reviews.text: This book breaks down complex concepts in a way that is accessible and educational. It is a great foundational read for anyone wanting to learn more about Computer Science.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: Good for students
customer_reviews.text: I’m a student and this was really helpful to prepare thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: Great book, perfect chapters/ sections for student learning. Vocab is not too difficult to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine O. Herzfeld

customer_reviews.title: No practice question
customer_reviews.text: There is no practice question to test understanding. I returned the book.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: NOT AP LEVEL
customer_reviews.text: Classic false advertising. This book is a good overview of javascript and html but has nothing to do with AP computer science. If you're looking for an AP book - stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Ko Panda

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: There are no practice questions, not really an AP prep course book
customer_reviews.author: Mom to book lovers

customer_reviews.title: The definitive guideline for AP Computer Science Principles
customer_reviews.text: This is my first year teaching APCS-P and this book saved me so much time by providing an outline of what to cover throughout the year to make sure my students are ready for the AP Exam in May. The other books referenced throughout this one are incredibly helpful as well and I draw a lot of my lesson plans from "Nine Algorithms."
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Griest

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Book For AP Computer Science Principles
customer_reviews.text: This book is terrific for an AP computer science principles class! Very detailed and very easy to understand. This book is a life savor and helped me get an A in my AP Computer Science Principles class. I definitely recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: bt

customer_reviews.title: All the Information
customer_reviews.text: This book has helped me a lot in my AP Compsci Principals class. It is straightforward, informative and covers everything that I need to know for the class. Not only that, but it is actually an interesting read. It opens your eyes to just how dominant the subject of Computer Science is in our world.
customer_reviews.author: Neon Khaled

customer_reviews.title: Must read
customer_reviews.text: This book consistently aided me throughout my year in AP comp-sci Principles. Covers the basics about any topic! Must have for Compsci Principles
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great resource for APCS-P!!!
customer_reviews.text: Kevin Hare is brilliant! This book was very helpful for me when I was studying for my computer science exam! I would highly recommend this book for anyone learning APCS-P.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Allen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Really well written, builds a great foundation for the world of computer science.
customer_reviews.author: John McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great Text
customer_reviews.text: Useful and logically presented. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Furnary

customer_reviews.title: BEST COMPUTER SCIENCE CONCEPT BOOK OUT THERE!
customer_reviews.text: As a new Computer Science teacher, this book is a life saver! Mr. Hare is on my list of must have authors for all computer science teachers. I have even shared this book with students and I feel it has a lot to offer them in terms of helping them with CSP concepts.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Hillis

customer_reviews.title: A MUST READ FOR CSP TEACHERS
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great resource for computer principles teachers. The author is beyond knowledgeable and helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intro to AP CSP
customer_reviews.text: I am an new AP CSP teacher and will teach it for the first time in the Fall. I felt the book was very aligned to the course. The content is straightforward and approachable. This will make it very manageable for students.
customer_reviews.author: mjacquot

customer_reviews.title: Great resource.
customer_reviews.text: Great resource for students (and parents). A must have for at-home and online learning or classroom instruction. Easy to understand and follow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great resource!
customer_reviews.text: Very well written and easy to understand. This book is a must for all CS students.
customer_reviews.author: William Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Very brief but solid reference book!
customer_reviews.text: I chose three stars because there could've been just a bit more information concerning CS concepts. This book almost made me feel like I was just reading a lexicon on computer science and there was room to expand. All in all still a good reference book!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Updated this year
customer_reviews.text: It's nice that the text is updated for the 2020-2021 AP Computer Science Principles curriculum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Computer Science Principles: The Foundational Concepts of Computer Science - For AP® Computer Science Principles
